page.title: 03Industry in St. Levan-SKRAPS
page.content: A group of six women have started a {new venture, named SKRAPS,}which they hope will bring more and{new work}into the parish. A{home based hand-made {children's clothes workshop}they make bodywarmers, jackets, rucksacks, also cushions for crabpots used as interior decorative features. Products are aimed at holidaymakers initially and are{sold through local outlets, also {shops in Penzance and St. Ives.}It is planned to make{adult versions}of the clothes through next winter. A further option is to offer products to{large {city stores as a special line. {Applique methods are used}to create a {unique design on each product.}At the moment the women each concentrate on one part of the work; cutting, sewing, creating design, but all can swap about.{SKRAPS hopes to grow}& take on extra help, the six retaining control.
